Class SldSlavers

java.lang.Object
org.mio.progettoingsoft.advCards.sealed.SldAdvCard
org.mio.progettoingsoft.advCards.sealed.SldSlavers
public final class SldSlavers extends SldAdvCard
Represents a "Slavers" adventure card in the game. This card type involves players encountering slavers, requiring them to overcome a certain strength value. Success can lead to rewards (credits and days lost, implying progress), while failure results in penalties, primarily crew loss. It extends SldAdvCard and provides specific logic for slaver encounters.

  • Constructor Details

    • SldSlavers

      public SldSlavers(int id, int level, int strength, int daysLost, int credits, int crewLost)
      Constructs a new SldSlavers adventure card.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier for this slaver card.
      level - The level of the slaver encounter.
      strength - The combat strength of the slavers.
      daysLost - The number of days lost as a reward for success.
      credits - The credits awarded as a reward for success.
      crewLost - The number of crew members lost as a penalty for failure.

    • loadSlaver

      public static SldSlavers loadSlaver(com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode node)
      Static factory method to load an SldSlavers object from a JSON node. It parses the node to extract ID, level, strength, days lost, reward (credits), and crew lost, then constructs a new SldSlavers instance.
      Parameters:
      node - The JsonNode containing the Slaver card data.
      Returns:
      A new SldSlavers instance populated with data from the JSON node.

    • init

      public void init(GameServer game)
      Initializes the Slavers card's state and context within the game. Sets up game and fly board references, and initializes the list of allowed players (all players on the fly board) and the player iterator. The card state is then typically transitioned by setNextPlayer().
      Specified by:
      init in class SldAdvCard
      Parameters:
      game - The GameServer instance managing the current game.

    • setNextPlayer

      public void setNextPlayer()
      Sets the next player to confront the slavers or proceeds to apply penalties to defeated players. If there are more players to act, the card state transitions to DRILL_CHOICE. Otherwise, it prepares to iterate through players who failed the strength check.
      Overrides:
      setNextPlayer in class SldAdvCard

    • comparePower

      public int comparePower(FlyBoard board, Player player)
      Description copied from class: SldAdvCard
      Throws an exception indicating that this card type does not implement a power comparison. Subclasses that involve comparing power (e.g., in combat) should override this method.
      Overrides:
      comparePower in class SldAdvCard
      Parameters:
      board - The FlyBoard context.
      player - The Player whose power is being compared.
      Returns:
      The result of the power comparison.

    • applyEffect

      public void applyEffect(Player player, List<Cordinate> drillsCordinate)
      Applies the effect of the Slavers card based on the player's provided drill power. Players activate drills to increase their fire power and compare it against the slaver's strength. Depending on the outcome, players might receive rewards (credits/days lost) or be added to the list of lostPlayers for crew removal.
      Parameters:
      player - The Player applying the effect.
      drillsCordinate - A list of Cordinate representing the drills activated by the player.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the card is not in an appropriate state (APPLYING, COMPARING, DRILL_CHOICE).
      BadPlayerException - if the provided player is not the current active player.

    • skipEffect

      public void skipEffect()
      Skips the acceptance of reward (credits and days lost) and proceeds directly to apply penalties to players who failed to overcome the slavers. This is typically called if the player who defeated the slavers chooses not to take the reward.

    • takeCredits

      public void takeCredits()
      Applies the reward (credits and days lost) to the player who successfully overcame the slavers. After applying the reward, it proceeds to apply penalties to players who failed.

    • setNextLoser

      public void setNextLoser()
      Sets the next player from the lostPlayers list to incur crew loss. If there are more losers, the card state transitions to CREW_REMOVE_CHOICE. Otherwise, the card's effect is finalized.

    • removeCrew

      public void removeCrew(String nickname, List<Cordinate> cordinates)
      Handles the removal of crew members from a player's ship due to failing the slaver encounter. This method updates the ship's state by removing guests from specified components and logs the event.
      Parameters:
      nickname - The nickname of the player from whom crew is to be removed.
      cordinates - A list of Cordinate representing the components from which crew is removed.
      Throws:
      IncorrectFlyBoardException - if the provided nickname does not match the actual player.
